2020-10-11T14:07:20Z: We'll catch you in two weeks' time for the Portuguese Grand Prix. Bye for now!
2020-10-11T14:05:52Z: Here's the report from a rather exciting Eifel GP! F1 Eifel GP: Hamilton takes victory to equal Schumacher's win recordLewis Hamilton equalled Michael Schumacher's all-time Formula 1 win record by taking victory in the Eifel Grand Prix ahead of Max Verstappen, while Valtteri Bottas retired with a mechanical problem
2020-10-11T14:01:33Z: Mick Schumacher presents Hamilton with one of his father's Mercedes helmets to commemorate matching Michael's record. Hamilton also gets a mention of Grand Prix 2 in, which is an all-time classic.
2020-10-11T13:54:07Z: Next question: what tattoo will Abiteboul end up with?
2020-10-11T13:53:08Z: Verstappen got the fastest lap point with a 1m28.139s.
2020-10-11T13:52:06Z: That's a 91st win for Hamilton to equal Michael Schumacher's record. Our maths were a bit out earlier...
2020-10-11T13:51:15Z: Gasly, Leclerc, Hulkenberg, Grosjean and Giovinazzi complete the top 10.
2020-10-11T13:50:43Z: Perez is just 1.4s behind Ricciardo, as Sainz gets fifth for McLaren.
2020-10-11T13:50:18Z: Max Verstappen gets second, as Daniel Ricciardo secures a long-awaited podium for Renault!
2020-10-11T13:49:30Z: And Lewis Hamilton wins the 2020 Eifel Grand Prix!
2020-10-11T13:49:07Z: Heading into the final lap the on-track tussles have quietened down so this could be it for the Eifel GP top 10 order.
2020-10-11T13:48:33Z: Final lap! Verstappen's giving it the beans, but it might be too little too late...
2020-10-11T13:47:17Z: It's the penultimate lap, which Hamilton begins having set a 1m28.145s.
2020-10-11T13:45:32Z: The Vettel vs Magnussen incident has been noted by the race stewards but no investigation is pending.
2020-10-11T13:45:04Z: Perez is starting to reel Ricciardo in a little bit, but he needs to find a few more tenths per lap to steal third.
2020-10-11T13:44:32Z: Vettel takes 11th place off Magnussen, albeit with a couple of wheels off the track, and with the Haas driver losing momentum that invites Raikkonen through to double the frustration for the Dane.
2020-10-11T13:43:30Z: Vettel gets punchy against Magnussen. The Danish driver missed the Turn 13-14 chicane and took the alternative route, which invited the Ferrari driver to close up on the main straight and attack between Turns 1-3. The pair rub wheels but avoid anything worse.
2020-10-11T13:43:17Z: Verstappen's pulled a little closer to Hamilton after going 0.3s quicker on that previous lap, but Hamilton's responded this time around.
2020-10-11T13:41:20Z: The tyre swaps appear to have neutralised this race a little bit, as everyone's got enough life to push.
2020-10-11T13:40:14Z: After losing two places at the restart Grosjean is doing well to hold on to ninth place in front of Giovinazzi. Further back both Vettel and Raikkonen dart ahead of Latifi to see the German up to 12th and the Finn in 13th.
2020-10-11T13:40:07Z: Ricciardo now opens the gap to Perez by half a second - which has given him a lot of comfort to secure that final podium place.
2020-10-11T13:37:44Z: That's now a 1m28.335s for Hamilton, looking to cement this win after the late safety car.
2020-10-11T13:36:53Z: Hamilton gets a 1m28.487s to take the fastest lap. His lead stands now at 2s.
2020-10-11T13:36:08Z: Gasly is producing a mega restart as he gets ahead of Leclerc at Turn 1 a lap later to take sixth place.
2020-10-11T13:35:50Z: Gasly steals sixth from Leclerc into turn 1, and he's going after Sainz now.
2020-10-11T13:34:55Z: Grosjean on old hard tyres is being eaten up at the restart, with Gasly and Hulkenberg already ahead of him. Gasly is seventh, Hulkenberg eighth and Grosjean is ninth defending against Giovinazzi.
2020-10-11T13:34:22Z: Ricciardo had a look at Verstappen on the restart, but the Renault held onto third.
2020-10-11T13:32:46Z: Leclerc, the leader of the un-lapped cars in sixth place, has just caught up the safety car train at the perfect moment with the race about to return to green flag conditions.
2020-10-11T13:30:46Z: The safety car will now come in at the end of the lap.
2020-10-11T13:30:22Z: The lapped cars have been instructed to overtake under the safety car - effectively everyone from Leclerc in P6 down - and the track is clear with the McLaren safely recovered.
2020-10-11T13:30:20Z: Ricciardo, Perez and Sainz are up with the leaders for a possible shoot-out.
2020-10-11T13:28:10Z: A flurry of pitstops by the midfield runners, all who have been lapped in this race, means they are taking quite a while to catch up the safety car train. Leclerc and Grosjean appear to be the highest placed drivers not to pit in this period.
2020-10-11T13:27:51Z: Verstappen also has a moan about the safety car, worried about the cold temperatures having an effect on the tyres.
2020-10-11T13:25:29Z: Perez does now pit, and he'll rejoin behind Ricciardo to put the pair on equal footing.
2020-10-11T13:24:37Z: Ricciardo takes the pitstop, bolting on some softs. Perez occupies third, but hasn't stopped.
2020-10-11T13:22:45Z: There's a small fire on the right-hand sidepod as the engine just gave up.
2020-10-11T13:22:22Z: With Norris stopping in a tricky place the safety car has been deployed!
2020-10-11T13:21:32Z: Norris pulls over at the side of the road. Game over for the McLaren driver.
2020-10-11T13:21:11Z: Perez is within 10s of Ricciardo now, having taken a full minute out of his podium rival.
2020-10-11T13:20:35Z: Vettel duly pits at the end of the lap to ditch his hards for fresh soft tyres, but it was a slow stop with a sticky front-right wheel. The Ferrari driver is back out in 15th place, only in front of Kvyat.
2020-10-11T13:19:32Z: Hamilton's opened the gap at the front to 10s. It's lap 43/60, while Verstappen has a full minute over Ricciardo in third.
2020-10-11T13:19:00Z: It is going from bad to worse for Vettel as Hulkenberg overtakes him at Turn 1 to take ninth place. Vettel radios that his fronts are dropping off and he doesn't think he can make it to the end of the race with 17 laps to go.
2020-10-11T13:17:17Z: Vettel is getting a bit beaten up now, as Gasly gets ahead of him for eighth place. The Ferrari driver fought for the place through the Turn 1-2 sequence but had to yield braking for Turn 3 which caused him to lock up his fronts.
2020-10-11T13:15:16Z: A lap later Leclerc gets ahead of Vettel but makes a meal of it at Turn 1, locking up and running wide, which also forces the German driver to take avoiding action. Messy, but the end result is Leclerc up to seventh.
2020-10-11T13:14:38Z: Perez has cut the gap to Ricciardo, and lies 14s behind. The Racing Point driver was a second faster than the Renault on that previous lap.
2020-10-11T13:13:52Z: Two-stopper Leclerc makes quick work of getting back ahead of Raikkonen for eighth place and now has Ferrari team-mate Vettel ahead of him.
2020-10-11T13:13:09Z: A lesser-spotted Lewis Hamilton, with a few flecks of graining on his tyres. He laps sixth-placed Norris.
2020-10-11T13:12:29Z: Giovinazzi pits from eighth place having been struggling for pace throughout that stint. The Italian is back on track in 13th place between the two Haas drivers.
2020-10-11T13:10:30Z: Out in front, Hamilton has now got an 8s lead over Verstappen. We've barely seen them given the action among the midfielders.
2020-10-11T13:10:03Z: Grosjean and his poorly finger has been shown the black and white flag for exceeding track limits one too many times. He's currently running in 13th place and 20-odd seconds in front of Haas team-mate Magnussen.
2020-10-11T13:09:50Z: Leclerc duly pits, relieving him of fifth. Battle on between Ricciardo, Perez and Sainz for third.
2020-10-11T13:09:15Z: Sainz, now let into sixth by Norris, is right on Leclerc's six now.
2020-10-11T13:08:42Z: Perez gets the move done into the chicane this time, giving him enough leeway to keep fourth as Leclerc can't get back at him with DRS this time.
2020-10-11T13:07:46Z: Norris and Sainz duly trade places without much fuss. The British driver has a 15-second buffer over Giovinazzi behinnd him in eighth place with 25 laps of the race to go.
2020-10-11T13:07:29Z: Lovely battle between Perez and Leclerc - Perez got the drive into the final corner to get around the outside, but Leclerc returns to fourth with DRS into turn 1.
2020-10-11T13:05:50Z: Perez is now having a go at Leclerc to try and grab fourth. He might have to get his elbows out, as Leclerc's been on the defensive today.
2020-10-11T13:04:35Z: With Gasly also pitting it means all drivers still in the race have stopped once, so the running order is back into line. Norris is bleeding time with his power unit issue and looks set to concede sixth place to McLaren team-mate Sainz in a couple of laps.
2020-10-11T13:01:57Z: Perez clears Norris at the chicane, as it looked like the McLaren just had nothing after the back-straight kink.
2020-10-11T13:01:14Z: Hulkenberg duly pits shortly after it being mentioned it and returns to the action on fresh medium tyres in 14th place but ahead of both Grosjean and Kvyat.
2020-10-11T12:58:31Z: Perez does indeed pit now for mediums, as does Sainz behind him to free up Ricciardo.
2020-10-11T12:57:57Z: Norris is seeing pink elephants pit, but he's told Perez has still yet to box. Meanwhile, Ricciardo is closing down Sainz for fifth.
2020-10-11T12:57:30Z: With all the action, clashes and retirements, super sub Hulkenberg hasn't had much of a shoutout. The German driver has climbed to ninth place but is yet to pit this afternoon - still has a good chance for points, mind.
2020-10-11T12:55:17Z: Dropping like flies this afternoon, it seems. Norris is still 1.3s clear of Perez, so it's not affecting him too much.
2020-10-11T12:53:29Z: At the front, Hamilton's four seconds ahead of Verstappen.
2020-10-11T12:53:21Z: Renault has reported Ocon retired with a suspected hydraulic issue. He joins Russell, Bottas and Albon in watching the rest of this race from the side of the track.
2020-10-11T12:51:22Z: Albon has been given a five-second time penalty for his clash with Kvyat. But it is much worse than that as he pits and retires the car.
2020-10-11T12:49:40Z: This is not turning into the race Albon had hoped for. He locks up at the first corner attempting an overtake up the inside on Gasly and comes so close to contact with an AlphaTauri for the second time today.
2020-10-11T12:47:34Z: Hamilton cements his advantage at the front with a 1m30.109s lap.
2020-10-11T12:45:57Z: The podium looks to be a straight fight between Norris, Perez and Ricciardo - who looks to be two-stopping.
2020-10-11T12:45:43Z: A driver who is in trouble is Raikkonen who has a 10-second time penalty for causing his collision with Russell. Not the way he would want to celebrate becoming F1's most experienced driver.
2020-10-11T12:44:33Z: The Albon and Kvyat clash has duly been put under investigation. Albon might be in trouble for that.
2020-10-11T12:43:18Z: Somehow Albon has avoided any serious damage in that clash with Kvyat, as the Russian completes a whole lap without his front wing before being able to return to the pits.
2020-10-11T12:43:14Z: Bottas is being told to box and retire. A huge shame for the polesitter.
2020-10-11T12:42:16Z: Bottas is dropping, and Ocon's now bearing down on him.
2020-10-11T12:41:35Z: Not for long though as Albon and Kvyat have a coming together at Turn 14. The Russian driver locks up and misses the chicane apex under pressure from Albon, but the Thai driver clips the AlphaTauri on the way through which rips Kvyat's front wing off.
2020-10-11T12:41:24Z: Bottas has no power! He's been passed by Norris AND Perez.
2020-10-11T12:39:41Z: Track is clear, we go again.
2020-10-11T12:39:28Z: Within 60 seconds the Virtual Safety Car period is over so back to green flag conditions.
2020-10-11T12:39:16Z: Hamilton and Verstappen are getting some cheap pit-stops under this VSC, so that's rather fortunate.
2020-10-11T12:38:35Z: We have a VSC to clear Russell's Williams.
2020-10-11T12:37:49Z: Russell has duly parked up off of the track and stepped out of his badly damaged Williams. That incident is under investigation and you'd feel Raikkonen has no case for his defence for that one.
2020-10-11T12:37:36Z: Bottas is now on Ricciardo's tail now his tyres are up to temperature. He gets past at the back chicane, nice and easy for Bottas.
2020-10-11T12:36:26Z: Russell gets an almighty clatter from Raikkonen on the exit of Turn 1 which tips the Williams driver into the air and turned around. The clash has broken Russell's suspension and punctured his left-rear tyre which looks to have ended his afternoon early.
2020-10-11T12:34:48Z: Bottas returns to the track on mediums, behind Ricciardo.
2020-10-11T12:33:48Z: Bottas will need to stop, as Verstappen's on him like a rash now.
2020-10-11T12:33:30Z: Out of nowhere, Hamilton absolutely steams around the outside of Bottas! Bottas locked up into turn 1, opening the door to Hamilton to grabs P1 in turn 2.
2020-10-11T12:32:46Z: Vettel duly pits after that spin with his medium tyres wrecked. The Ferrari driver switches to the hard tyre which certainly isn't the fancied race tyre for this weekend so it looks like a tough afternoon ahead for the German driver.
2020-10-11T12:30:37Z: Vettel spins at the first corner! Is that because of the rain in the air? He is OK to continue having avoided the barriers in the run-off area.
2020-10-11T12:30:13Z: Leclerc retreats to the pits, freeing up Norris and Perez. Mediums for Leclerc.
2020-10-11T12:29:28Z: Leclerc's absolutely dropped into the clutches of Norris and Perez, who are really battling hard for sixth. Perez tries to get the move on Norris but the McLaren holds on.
2020-10-11T12:27:47Z: Ricciardo wrests fourth from Leclerc, taking the outside of turn 1 and carrying enough speed around into turn 2 to make the move stick.
2020-10-11T12:26:57Z: Sainz has just run wide at Turn 4 and later in the lap missed the apex at Turn 14. Looks like it might be getting slippery for the Spaniard already.
2020-10-11T12:26:56Z: Looks like there was damage to that front left, perhaps a legacy of that lap one lock-up.
2020-10-11T12:25:43Z: Albon comes into the pits for mediums, perhaps to try and get track position over Leclerc and Ricciardo.
2020-10-11T12:24:59Z: Verstappen did a 1m31.938s last time around to prise the fastest lap from Hamilton. He's staying with the Merc pair.
2020-10-11T12:23:12Z: Ricciardo has another tilt at Leclerc, but the Ferrari driver holds the line through the opening complex and keeps the Renault at bay.
2020-10-11T12:21:27Z: Ricciardo has a look at Leclerc into turn 1, but can't make it happen. He's really close to the Ferrari though, so it's surely a matter of time.
2020-10-11T12:20:17Z: Bottas sets a 1m32.211s to set the fastest lap and open a 1.6s lead to Hamilton.
2020-10-11T12:19:48Z: Leclerc, as predicted, has Ricciardo right on his tail. Albon has a chance to buy into this too if he can close in on the pair.
2020-10-11T12:19:41Z: Vettel was so close to a jump start as the TV replays show the Ferrari driver moving in his grid slot before slamming on the brakes before the lights went out. He was stationary for the start so should avoid any punishment.
2020-10-11T12:17:30Z: Leclerc's already dropped 4s to Verstappen, giving Ricciardo a chance to fight with the Ferrari. Verstappen's keeping pace with the two Mercedes.
2020-10-11T12:17:22Z: Tough opening lap for Grosjean though, who has lost four places and is currently in last place.
2020-10-11T12:15:44Z: Albon had a slightly sluggish getaway and lost fifth to Ricciardo, but the Australian braked early into T3 and meant Albon had to jump on the brakes quick-smart.
2020-10-11T12:15:39Z: Smart start further back by Giovinazzi as he climbs up to 11th place, while super sub Hulkenberg is already up to 17th place having started last.
2020-10-11T12:14:48Z: Hamilton had the inside for turn 1, but Bottas gets the switch back into turn 2 and keeps the lead!
2020-10-11T12:13:13Z: The drivers take to the grid, ready for the start...
2020-10-11T12:08:39Z: Tyre info: all on softs apart from Vettel, Gasly, Kvyat and Grosjean.
2020-10-11T12:06:44Z: There's the F1 theme tune. Remember at the start of 2018 when everyone hated it, and now it feels kinda empty without it?
2020-10-11T12:05:20Z: Just five minutes to go until we get an eyeful of action at the Eifel GP.
2020-10-11T12:03:19Z: Both McLaren drivers are sporting helmets they painted themselves, in support of the charity Mind. Norris has gone for something very modernist, while Sainz has opted for something rather abstract.
2020-10-11T11:58:56Z: It's nice to have the Nurburgring back on the calendar for the first time since 2013. If we get something akin to the 1999 race, we'll be very happy indeed.
2020-10-11T11:56:54Z: Temperature notes: air temperature is 8.6 °C, track temperature 15.5 °C. Risk of rain at 40%.
2020-10-11T11:51:38Z: Raikkonen, soon to have the most F1 caps of all-time, starts alongside last-place-man Nico Hulkenberg - who was given the call-up to Racing Point at 11am yesterday as Lance Stroll is currently unwell.
2020-10-11T11:49:31Z: A hive of activity around Sergio Perez's car on the grid, as he seems to have a small problem somewhere in the cockpit.
2020-10-11T11:48:37Z: Kimi Raikkonen, starting from the rear of the field, will begin his 323rd F1 start - and will officially break Rubens Barrichello's record.
2020-10-11T11:47:28Z: Hamilton will start alongside Bottas, who has his 14th pole of his F1 career. Verstappen and Leclerc were both impressive in quali, and occupy row two.
2020-10-11T11:46:27Z: Some stuff already - Lewis Hamilton has radioed in to ask about his steering wheel, which seems to be somewhat loose.
2020-10-11T11:45:35Z: Good afternoon everyone! In 25 minutes, the Eifel Grand Prix will get underway at the Nurburgring! Hope you're all sitting comfortably - and if you've forgotten we start an hour earlier today, now's your warning!
